intro: Poterium stenolophum, commonly known as the narrow-ridge papyrus, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant features tall, narrow leaves that form dense clumps, and it produces small, inconspicuous flowers in spikelets. It thrives in moist, swampy environments and is often found in marshes and along the edges of lakes. Due to its ecological importance, it plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils and supporting local biodiversity.
